history.content:
From the College of Engineering:

If it’s a joint major student, and they were admitted through change of college, they cannot drop to a single major. 
If it’s a joint major student admitted as a freshman or transfer to the college, they could meet with their ESS adviser and drop to one major. 
If it’s a double major student, they could drop to one major so long as it appears they could complete the major in 8 semesters (freshman admit)—they won’t get an extra semester.

i know for l&s, if you declare a double major and later feel that you can't finish it, you can switch your major to a single major instead (picking one out of the two). can u do this in the college of engineering too? can't find anything on this online
history.subject: switch double major to single major CoE
